response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<Product> it = allProducts.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
  p= it.next();
  i= allProducts.indexOf(p);
  if (p.getId().equals(productId)){
    allProducts.remove(i);
    System.out.println("Successfully removed the product " + pid);
    return;
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new allProducts.iterator() in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.
Question: How to get the value of a key in a JSONObject: I have a JSONObject that contains a key called "name". I want to get the value of that key. I tried using JSONObject.get("name") but it doesn't work.
Please using this api: JSONObject.get("name").
Answer:<<<api>>>: JSONObject.get("name")
<<<code>>>: JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject(jsonString);
String name = jsonObject.getString("name");
<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new JSONObject(jsonString) in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.
